001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Builder;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Proxy;
005import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
006import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.TemplateMethod;
007import net.tvburger.jdl.common.utils.Floats;
008import net.tvburger.jdl.model.DataSet;
009import net.tvburger.jdl.model.EstimationFunction;
010import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.ObjectiveFunction;
011import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Optimizer;
012import net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.Regime;
013
014import java.util.ArrayList;
015import java.util.Iterator;
016import java.util.List;
017import java.util.Optional;
018import java.util.function.Predicate;
019
020/**
021 * Composes and executes a chain of {@link Regime} decorators.
022 *
023 * <p>The chain stores regimes in order and, when trained, delegates to the
024 * <em>top</em> (last) regime. If the chain is empty, this class will invoke
025 * the provided {@link Optimizer} directly on the full {@link DataSet} as a
026 * single batch (a safe no-op fallback if the caller omitted regimes).</p>
027 *
028 * <h3>Semantics</h3>
029 * <ul>
030 *   <li><strong>Top regime:</strong> the last element in {@code chainedRegimes} receives
031 *       the {@link #train} call and typically wraps the rest.</li>
032 *   <li><strong>Lookup:</strong> {@link #getRegime(Class)} and {@link #findRegime(java.util.function.Predicate)}
033 *       return the first matching regime for introspection or reconfiguration.</li>
034 *   <li><strong>Iteration:</strong> Implements {@link Iterable} to expose the chain order (top to bottom).</li>
035 * </ul>
036 */
037@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
038public class ChainedRegime implements Regime, Iterable<Regime> {
039
040    /**
041     * The ordered chain of regimes; the last element is the top/outermost decorator.
042     */
043    protected final List<Regime> chainedRegimes;
044
045    /**
046     * Creates a new chain.
047     *
048     * @param chainedRegimes ordered regimes; the last is considered the "top".
049     *                       May be empty; in that case {@link #train} falls back
050     *                       to direct optimizer invocation if provided.
051     */
052    protected ChainedRegime(List<Regime> chainedRegimes) {
053        this.chainedRegimes = chainedRegimes;
054    }
055
056    /**
057     * Trains by delegating to the topmost regime in the chain. If the chain is empty,
058     * invokes the {@link Optimizer} directly (if non-null) on the full dataset.
059     *
060     * @param estimationFunction the model to train
061     * @param trainingSet        the dataset to train on
062     * @param objective          the objective (loss) function
063     * @param optimizer          the optimizer to apply updates (used directly if chain is empty)
064     * @param <E>                the type of estimation function
065     */
066    @Override
067    public <E extends EstimationFunction> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E> optimizer) {
068        if (chainedRegimes.isEmpty()) {
069            if (optimizer != null) {
070                optimizer.optimize(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective);
071            }
072        } else {
073            chainedRegimes.getLast().train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
074        }
075    }
076
077    /**
078     * Returns an iterator over the regimes in from top to bottom.
079     */
080    @Override
081    public Iterator<Regime> iterator() {
082        return chainedRegimes.reversed().iterator();
083    }
084
085    /**
086     * Returns the first regime assignable to {@code regimeTypeClass}, or throws if none.
087     *
088     * @param regimeTypeClass the desired regime type
089     * @param <R>             type parameter of the regime
090     * @return the first matching regime
091     * @throws java.util.NoSuchElementException if none found
092     */
093    public <R extends Regime> R asRegime(Class<R> regimeTypeClass) {
094        return getRegime(regimeTypeClass).orElseThrow();
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * Returns the first regime assignable to the requested type, if any.
099     *
100     * @param regimeTypeClass the desired regime type
101     * @param <R>             type parameter of the regime
102     * @return an {@link Optional} containing the first match, or empty
103     */
104    public <R extends Regime> Optional<R> getRegime(Class<R> regimeTypeClass) {
105        for (Regime regime : chainedRegimes) {
106            if (regimeTypeClass.isInstance(regime)) {
107                return Optional.of(regimeTypeClass.cast(regime));
108            }
109        }
110        return Optional.empty();
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Returns the first regime matching the predicate, if any.
115     *
116     * @param predicate match condition
117     * @return an {@link Optional} containing the first match, or empty
118     */
119    public Optional<Regime> findRegime(Predicate<? super Regime> predicate) {
120        for (Regime regime : chainedRegimes) {
121            if (predicate.test(regime)) return Optional.of(regime);
122        }
123        return Optional.empty();
124    }
125
126    /**
127     * {@inheritDoc}
128     */
129    @Override
130    public String toString() {
131        return "ChainedRegime" + chainedRegimes;
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * A lightweight link that forwards {@link Regime#train} to another regime in the chain
136     * by index (supports negative indexes counted from the end).
137     *
138     * <p>Used internally by builders to target the current top or relative positions
139     * while the chain is being assembled.</p>
140     */
141    @Proxy
142    private class Link implements Regime {
143
144        /**
145         * The target index; negative values are relative to the end.
146         */
147        private final int linkedRegimeIndex;
148
149        private Link(int linkedRegimeIndex) {
150            this.linkedRegimeIndex = linkedRegimeIndex;
151        }
152
153        /**
154         * Resolves the linked regime by index (handling negative indexes).
155         *
156         * @return the target regime or {@code null} if out of bounds
157         */
158        private Regime getLinkedRegime() {
159            int index = linkedRegimeIndex < 0 ? chainedRegimes.size() + linkedRegimeIndex : linkedRegimeIndex;
160            return index < chainedRegimes.size() && index >= 0
161                    ? chainedRegimes.get(index)
162                    : null;
163        }
164
165        /**
166         * Forwards training to the linked regime if available; otherwise falls back
167         * to direct optimizer invocation (if non-null).
168         */
169        @Override
170        public <E extends EstimationFunction> void train(E estimationFunction, DataSet trainingSet, ObjectiveFunction objective, Optimizer<? super E> optimizer) {
171            Regime linkedRegime = getLinkedRegime();
172            if (linkedRegime != null) {
173                linkedRegime.train(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective, optimizer);
174            } else {
175                if (optimizer != null) {
176                    optimizer.optimize(estimationFunction, trainingSet, objective);
177                }
178            }
179        }
180    }
181
182    /**
183     * Abstract base for creating fluent builders of {@link ChainedRegime}.
184     *
185     * <p>This class is not used directly; instead, concrete subclasses such as
186     * {@link TopDownChainer} and {@link BottomUpChainer} extend it to provide
187     * a fluent DSL for assembling training regimes. It maintains a list of
188     * chained regimes and a {@code targetRegime} pointer so that each newly
189     * added decorator can wrap the current top of the chain.</p>
190     *
191     * <p>Fluent methods such as {@link #epochs(int)}, {@link #miniBatch(int)},
192     * and {@link #reportObjective()} add specific {@link Regime} decorators
193     * around the current target, enabling expressive construction of complex
194     * training pipelines without manual wiring.</p>
195     *
196     * <p>Once the chain is complete, {@link #build()} produces an immutable
197     * {@link ChainedRegime} that can be passed to a {@code Trainer}.</p>
198     *
199     * @param <M> the concrete builder subtype (for fluent chaining)
200     * @see TopDownChainer
201     * @see BottomUpChainer
202     */
203    @TemplateMethod
204    protected static abstract class Modifiable<M extends Modifiable<M>> extends ChainedRegime {
205
206        /**
207         * The regime that the next decorator should wrap.
208         */
209        protected Regime targetRegime;
210
211        /**
212         * Creates a new, initially empty chain builder.
213         */
214        protected Modifiable() {
215            super(new ArrayList<>());
216        }
217
218        /**
219         * Adds the given regime to the chain and updates {@link #targetRegime}.
220         *
221         * @param regime the regime to add
222         * @return {@code this} builder
223         */
224        protected abstract M chainRegime(Regime regime);
225
226        /**
227         * Adds a {@link BatchRegime} decorator around the current target.
228         *
229         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
230         * @see BatchRegime
231         */
232        public final M batch() {
233            return chainRegime(new BatchRegime(targetRegime));
234        }
235
236        /**
237         * Adds an {@link OnlineRegime} decorator around the current target.
238         *
239         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
240         * @see OnlineRegime
241         */
242        public final M online() {
243            return chainRegime(new OnlineRegime(targetRegime));
244        }
245
246        /**
247         * Adds a {@link MiniBatchRegime} decorator with a default batch size of 32.
248         *
249         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
250         * @see MiniBatchRegime
251         */
252        public final M miniBatch() {
253            return miniBatch(32);
254        }
255
256        /**
257         * Adds a {@link MiniBatchRegime} decorator with the given batch size.
258         *
259         * @param samplesPerLearning the number of samples per mini-batch (must be > 0)
260         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
261         * @see MiniBatchRegime
262         */
263        public final M miniBatch(int samplesPerLearning) {
264            return chainRegime(new MiniBatchRegime(targetRegime, samplesPerLearning));
265        }
266
267        /**
268         * Adds an {@link EpochRegime} decorator with a default of 1,000 epochs.
269         *
270         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
271         * @see EpochRegime
272         */
273        public final M epochs() {
274            return epochs(1_000);
275        }
276
277        /**
278         * Adds an {@link EpochRegime} decorator with the given number of epochs.
279         *
280         * @param epochs the number of epochs to run (must be >= 1)
281         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
282         * @see EpochRegime
283         */
284        public final M epochs(int epochs) {
285            return chainRegime(new EpochRegime(targetRegime, epochs));
286        }
287
288
289        /**
290         * Adds an {@link ObjectiveReportingRegime} decorator that reports
291         * objective (loss) values with dumping enabled.
292         *
293         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
294         * @see ObjectiveReportingRegime
295         */
296        public final M reportObjective() {
297            return chainRegime(new ObjectiveReportingRegime(targetRegime, true));
298        }
299
300        /**
301         * Adds a {@link StopIfNoImprovementRegime} decorator with default
302         * parameters (stall limit = 2, min improvement = {@link Floats#EPSILON}).
303         *
304         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
305         * @see StopIfNoImprovementRegime
306         */
307        public final M stopIfNoImprovements() {
308            return stopIfNoImprovements(2);
309        }
310
311        /**
312         * Adds a {@link StopIfNoImprovementRegime} decorator with the given stall limit.
313         *
314         * @param maxStalledEpochs maximum consecutive stalled epochs allowed
315         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
316         * @see StopIfNoImprovementRegime
317         */
318        public final M stopIfNoImprovements(int maxStalledEpochs) {
319            return stopIfNoImprovements(maxStalledEpochs, Floats.EPSILON);
320        }
321
322        /**
323         * Adds a {@link StopIfNoImprovementRegime} decorator with default stall limit (2)
324         * and the specified dumping flag.
325         *
326         * @param dumpLosses whether to print loss values during training
327         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
328         * @see StopIfNoImprovementRegime
329         */
330        public final M stopIfNoImprovements(boolean dumpLosses) {
331            return stopIfNoImprovements(2, dumpLosses);
332        }
333
334        /**
335         * Adds a {@link StopIfNoImprovementRegime} decorator with a stall limit
336         * and dumping flag.
337         *
338         * @param maxStalledEpochs maximum consecutive stalled epochs allowed
339         * @param dumpLosses       whether to print loss values during training
340         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
341         * @see StopIfNoImprovementRegime
342         */
343        public final M stopIfNoImprovements(int maxStalledEpochs, boolean dumpLosses) {
344            return stopIfNoImprovements(2, Floats.EPSILON, dumpLosses);
345        }
346
347
348        /**
349         * Adds a {@link StopIfNoImprovementRegime} decorator with the given
350         * stall limit and minimum improvement threshold.
351         *
352         * @param maxStalledEpochs maximum consecutive stalled epochs allowed
353         * @param minImprovement   minimum relative improvement (percentage) required
354         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
355         * @see StopIfNoImprovementRegime
356         */
357        public final M stopIfNoImprovements(int maxStalledEpochs, float minImprovement) {
358            return stopIfNoImprovements(maxStalledEpochs, minImprovement, true);
359        }
360
361        /**
362         * Adds a {@link StopIfNoImprovementRegime} decorator with full configuration.
363         *
364         * @param maxStalledEpochs maximum consecutive stalled epochs allowed
365         * @param minImprovement   minimum relative improvement (percentage) required
366         * @param dumpLosses       whether to print loss values during training
367         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
368         * @see StopIfNoImprovementRegime
369         */
370        public final M stopIfNoImprovements(int maxStalledEpochs, float minImprovement, boolean dumpLosses) {
371            return chainRegime(StopIfNoImprovementRegime.create(targetRegime, maxStalledEpochs, minImprovement, dumpLosses));
372        }
373
374        /**
375         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with default options (dump after training).
376         *
377         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
378         * @see DumpNodesRegime
379         */
380        public final M dumpNodes() {
381            return dumpNodes(false);
382        }
383
384        /**
385         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with an initial dump toggle.
386         *
387         * @param firstTime whether to dump before the first training step
388         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
389         * @see DumpNodesRegime
390         */
391        public final M dumpNodes(boolean firstTime) {
392            return dumpNodes(firstTime, false);
393        }
394
395        /**
396         * Adds a {@link DumpNodesRegime} decorator with full configuration.
397         *
398         * @param firstTime     whether to dump before the first training step
399         * @param includeInputs whether to include input nodes in the dump
400         * @return this builder (for fluent chaining)
401         * @see DumpNodesRegime
402         */
403        public final M dumpNodes(boolean firstTime, boolean includeInputs) {
404            return chainRegime(new DumpNodesRegime(targetRegime, firstTime, includeInputs));
405        }
406
407        /**
408         * Finalizes the builder and creates an immutable {@link ChainedRegime}.
409         *
410         * <p>The returned {@link ChainedRegime} contains the current list of
411         * decorators in the order they were added. The underlying list is wrapped
412         * with {@link List#copyOf(java.util.Collection)} to ensure immutability,
413         * so further modifications to this builder will not affect the built chain.</p>
414         *
415         * @return an immutable {@link ChainedRegime} representing the current builder state
416         * @see ChainedRegime
417         */
418        protected final ChainedRegime build() {
419            return new ChainedRegime(List.copyOf(chainedRegimes));
420        }
421
422    }
423
424    /**
425     * Fluent builder that composes the chain from <em>top down</em>.
426     * <p>Each added decorator becomes the new head, wrapping the previous head.
427     * Internally uses a {@link Link} to refer to the evolving predecessor.</p>
428     */
429    @Builder
430    public static final class TopDownChainer extends ChainedRegime.Modifiable<TopDownChainer> {
431
432        /**
433         * Initializes the builder with a link pointing one-before-last, then moves as items are added.
434         */
435        public TopDownChainer() {
436            targetRegime = nextLink();
437        }
438
439        private Link nextLink() {
440            return new Link(-2 - chainedRegimes.size());
441        }
442
443        /**
444         * {@inheritDoc}
445         */
446        @Override
447        protected TopDownChainer chainRegime(Regime regime) {
448            chainedRegimes.addFirst(regime);
449            targetRegime = nextLink();
450            return this;
451        }
452
453        /**
454         * Finalizes the composition and returns unmodifiable chain.
455         */
456        public ChainedRegime bottomChain() {
457            return build();
458        }
459    }
460
461    /**
462     * Fluent builder that composes the chain from <em>bottom up</em>.
463     * <p>Each added decorator wraps the previous target; the most recently added
464     * decorator becomes the top.</p>
465     */
466    @Builder
467    public static final class BottomUpChainer extends ChainedRegime.Modifiable<BottomUpChainer> {
468
469        /**
470         * {@inheritDoc}
471         */
472        @Override
473        protected BottomUpChainer chainRegime(Regime regime) {
474            targetRegime = regime;
475            chainedRegimes.add(targetRegime);
476            return this;
477        }
478
479        /**
480         * Finalizes the composition and returns unmodifiable chain.
481         */
482        public ChainedRegime topChain() {
483            return build();
484        }
485
486    }
487
488}
